At Inside Policy, project management is about creating the conditions for good work to happen. It involves planning and sequencing complex projects, supporting multidisciplinary teams, managing risk and resourcing, and enabling thoughtful, ethical and high-quality delivery of policy, research and evaluation work for both state and federal governments, the not-for-profit and philanthropic sector.

Why join Inside Policy?

Inside Policy offers the opportunity to lead meaningful project work in a purpose-driven organisation, with the support, trust and flexibility to do your best work well.

You’ll work in an environment that values thoughtful delivery, clear priorities and strong relationships, and where people are supported to balance high-quality work with the realities of life.

Founded by proud Kuku Yalanji woman Natalie Walker, Inside Policy is a purpose-driven company guided by strong First Nations leadership. We place cultural knowledge and lived experience at the centre of how we approach our work.

We’re a social and economic policy advisory firm committed to making a difference for Australia’s most vulnerable communities. Our team (the “Insiders”) deliver high-quality evaluation and research projects for federal and state governments, philanthropic organisations and not-for-profits.

·      Oversee project governance, resourcing and coordination across teams, working closely with senior leaders to balance priorities.

·      Support high-quality project setup, delivery and reporting, ensuring projects are well run and clients are well supported.

·      Build strong working relationships with clients and partners, supporting clear communication and trust throughout delivery.

This is a leadership role for someone who enjoys making complex projects run well, supporting others to deliver, and strengthening how an organisation delivers work at scale. ·       Experience working in consulting, advisory, evaluation or research contexts, with responsibility for managing and delivering projects rather than overseeing programs or policy processes.

·       Sound judgement, strong organisational skills and the ability to manage competing priorities.

·       A collaborative, calm and practical approach to problem-solving and delivery.

·       An interest in improving systems, processes and ways of working to support better project outcomes.

QUALIFICATIONS
A relevant tertiary qualification, or equivalent professional experience, with demonstrated responsibility for leading and delivering complex projects or work programs in advisory, evaluation or consulting contexts.

OUR CULTURE AND COMMITMENT

We are a small yet growing band of committed evaluators and researchers who truly want to make a difference. Company description:



Insignia Financial Limited is an Australian financial services company which offers a range of products and services including financial advice, superannuation, investment management and trustee services



Job description:



We're seeking an experienced Senior Investment Analyst - Transition Management to play a critical role in managing complex, multi-asset class transitions within a multi-manager trust investment structure across Super and non-Super clients.

This role sits at the intersection of investment strategy, execution, and stakeholder management, partnering closely with MLC Asset Management to ensure asset management changes are implemented efficiently, cost-effectively, and with minimal risk, ultimately delivering better performance outcomes for members and clients.

How You'll Make an Impact

You'll be responsible for the end-to-end planning and execution of investment transitions, ensuring smooth delivery, strong governance, and best execution outcomes in a highly collaborative environment.

Key Responsibilities & Capabilities

Manage end-to-end asset transition projects across multi-asset, Super and non-Super unit trust structures, following approved investment changes
Plan and coordinate complex transitions including manager terminations and appointments, asset movements, legacy asset migration, and internal unit trust registry changes
Propose and implement transition strategies, considering member impact, unit registry transactions, liquidity, market impact, buy/sell spreads, tax (CGT, stamp duty), and implicit/explicit transaction costs
Appoint, coordinate, and monitor external transition managers and custodians, ensuring strong risk management, governance, and execution quality
Act as the central point of coordination across Investment, Fund Accounting & Operations, Custody, Product, and Legal to keep timelines, pipelines, and dependencies on track
Provide trading and execution advice (understanding trade execution and life cycle, without executing trades) and support cost analysis and financial modelling
Support new business activity including RFPs, pitches, and presentations, contributing analytical insight on asset allocation and investment structures
Build strong relationships with senior investment professionals through clear communication, proactive problem-solving, and a solutions-focused mindset

What you'll bring:

Extensive experience in financial services, wealth or asset management, with strong exposure to Unit Trust structures
Proven understanding of asset transition management and investment implementation within complex investment structures
Strong risk management mindset, able to question assumptions and assess downstream impacts
Solid knowledge of asset movements, execution strategies, liquidity, buy/sell spreads, and market impacts
Understanding of portfolio construction, asset allocation, and liquidity management, including tax considerations (e.g. CGT)
Highly organised and able to manage multiple concurrent, project-based transitions
Strong analytical and financial modelling skills, with advanced Excel capability
Autonomous, solutions-focused professional with strong stakeholder management and communication skills

This is a flat-structured team, but with exceptional exposure to senior investment professionals, complex investment decisions, and high-impact projects across the investment function. It's an ideal role for someone who wants breadth, depth, and visibility rather than a narrow operational pathway.
